text: @CliveJFox @EelGroup @DefraGovUK @EnvAgency @EU_ENV @EU_MARE @CITES @severnrivers @EelGroup are the experts here, but argument is that habitat degradation  / barriers etc mean that Severn/Parrett etc cannot support Ns of glass eels that arrive - so there is a natural surplus that can be used (incl. for stocking)

@EdenSwimmer @NECumbria @EnvAgency It's certainly not unusual to find dead salmon at this time of the year. Post-spawning mortality is very common but, unlike Pacific salmon, a good number of Atlantic salmon will find their way back down river in order to complete another life-cycle.

urls.title: Waste enforcement continues despite the pandemic
urls.description: At the end of the year, Malcolm Lythgo, Head of Waste Regulation at the Environment Agency, reflects back on the waste enforcement work of the Agency through 2020 and the new partnerships it has made that strengthen its regulatory power.
